00067         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00068         /// @class Window
00069         /// @headerfile uiwindow.h
00070         /// @brief This is a container widget capable of holding any other widget.
00071         /// @details
00072         ///////////////////////////////////////
00073         class PHYS_LIB Window : public Widget
00074         {
00075             protected:
00076                 Rectangle* WindowBack;
00077                 //Caption* WindowTitle;
00078                 std::vector<OffsetButtonInfo> Buttons;
00079                 std::vector<OffsetRectangleInfo> Rectangles;
00080                 std::vector<OffsetCaptionInfo> Captions;
00081                 std::vector<OffsetMarkupTextInfo> MarkupTexts;
00082                 std::vector<OffsetWidgetInfo> Widgets;
00083                 /// @brief For use with widget update/automation.
00084                 void Update(bool Force = false);
00085                 /// @brief Internal function for setting the location(position) of this widget.
00086                 void SetLocation(const Vector2 &Position);
00087                 /// @brief Internal function for setting the area(size) of this widget.
00088                 void SetArea(const Vector2 &Size);
00089                 /// @brief Calculates a new offset for an individual element.
00090                 Vector2 CalculateOffset(const Vector2 NewSize, const Vector2 OldSize, const Vector2 EleOffset, UI::ResizeableAnchor Anchor);
00091                 /// @brief Calculates a new size for an individual element.
00092                 Vector2 CalculateSize(const Vector2 NewSize, const Vector2 OldSize, const Vector2 EleSize, UI::ResizeableTether Tether);
00093             public:
00094                 /// @brief Standard initialization constructor.
00095                 /// @param name The name of the window.
00096                 /// @param Position The position of the window.
00097                 /// @param Size The size of the window.
00098                 /// @param Layer The parent layer this window belongs to.
00099                 Window(ConstString& name, const Vector2 Position, const Vector2 Size, UILayer* Layer);
00100                 /// @brief Standard destructor.
00101                 virtual ~Window();
00102                 /// @brief Sets the visibility of this window.
00103                 /// @param visible Bool determining whether or not this window should be visible.
00104                 virtual void SetVisible(bool visible);
00105                 /// @brief Gets the visibility of this window.
00106                 /// @return Returns a bool representing the visibility of this window.
00107                 virtual bool IsVisible();
00108                 /// @brief Forces this window to be shown.
00109                 virtual void Show();
00110                 /// @brief Forces this window to hide.
00111                 virtual void Hide();
00112                 /// @brief Gets the background object of this window.
00113                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the rectangle that is the background for this window.
00114                 virtual Rectangle* GetWindowBack();
00115                 /// @brief Checks to see if the current mouse position is over this window.
00116                 /// @return Returns a bool value, true if the mouse is over this window, false if it's not.
00117                 virtual bool CheckMouseHover();
00118                 /// @brief Sets the relative position of this window.
00119                 /// @details The position is relative to the screen size.  Values range from 0.0 to 1.0.
00120                 /// @param Position A vector2 representing the relative position of this window.
00121                 virtual void SetPosition(const Vector2 Position);
00122                 /// @brief Gets the relative position of this window.
00123                 /// @details The position is relative to the screen size.  Values range from 0.0 to 1.0.
00124                 /// @return Returns a vector2 representing the relative position of this window.
00125                 virtual Vector2 GetPosition();
00126                 /// @brief Sets the pixel position of this window.
00127                 /// @param Position A vector2 representing the pixel position of this window.
00128                 virtual void SetActualPosition(const Vector2 Position);
00129                 /// @brief Sets the pixel position of this window.
00130                 /// @return Returns a vector2 representing the pixel position of this window.
00131                 virtual Vector2 GetActualPosition();
00132                 /// @brief Sets the relative size of this window.
00133                 /// @details The size is relative to the screen size.  Values range from 0.0 to 1.0.
00134                 /// @param Size A vector2 representing the relative size of this window.
00135                 virtual void SetSize(const Vector2 Size);
00136                 /// @brief Gets the relative size of this window.
00137                 /// @details The size is relative to the screen size.  Values range from 0.0 to 1.0.
00138                 /// @return Returns a vector2 representing the relative size of this window.
00139                 virtual Vector2 GetSize();
00140                 /// @brief Sets the pixel size of this window.
00141                 /// @param Size A vector2 representing the pixel size of this window.
00142                 virtual void SetActualSize(const Vector2 Size);
00143                 /// @brief Sets the pixel size of this window.
00144                 /// @return Returns a vector2 representing the pixel size of this window.
00145                 virtual Vector2 GetActualSize();
00146                 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00147                 // Creating and working with All Basic UI Elements
00148                 ///////////////////////////////////////
00149                 /// @brief Creates a button within this Window.
00150                 /// @details This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).
00151                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the created button.
00152                 /// @param Name The name of the button.
00153                 /// @param Position The top left position of the button.
00154                 /// @param Size The size of the Button.
00155                 Button* CreateButton(ConstString& Name, const Vector2 Position, const Vector2 Size);
00156                 /// @brief Creates a text button within this Window.
00157                 /// @details This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).
00158                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the created button.
00159                 /// @param Name The name of the button.
00160                 /// @param Position The top left position of the button.
00161                 /// @param Size The size of the Button.
00162                 /// @param Glyph One of the glyphs specified in your gorilla file.  Must be valid.
00163                 /// @param Text Any text you want printed on the button.
00164                 TextButton* CreateTextButton(ConstString& Name, const Vector2 Position, const Vector2 Size, const Whole Glyph, ConstString Text);
00165                 /// @brief Gets an already created button by name.
00166                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the button of the specified name.
00167                 Button* GetButton(ConstString& Name);
00168                 /// @brief Gets an already created button by index.
00169                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the button at the specified index.
00170                 Button* GetButton(const Whole Index);
00171                 /// @brief Gets the OffsetButtonInfo of an already created button by name.
00172                 /// @return Returns a reference to the button of the specified name.
00173                 OffsetButtonInfo* GetOffsetButtonInfo(ConstString& Name);
00174                 /// @brief Gets the OffsetButtonInfo of an already created button by index.
00175                 /// @return Returns a reference to the button at the specified index.
00176                 OffsetButtonInfo* GetOffsetButtonInfo(const Whole Index);
00177                 /// @brief Gets the number of buttons created and stored in this class.
00178                 /// @return Returns the number of buttons this class is storing.
00179                 Whole GetNumButtons();
00180                 /// @brief Destroys a button.
00181                 /// @param ToBeDestroyed Pointer to the button you want destroyed.
00182                 void DestroyButton(UI::Button* ToBeDestroyed);
00183                 /// @brief Creates a rectangle within this Window.
00184                 /// @details This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0). @n
00185                 /// Rectangles are innately put behind all captions, so z-order is not necessary.
00186                 /// @param Position The top left position of the button.
00187                 /// @param Size The size of the Button.
00188                 Rectangle* CreateRectangle(const Vector2 Position, const Vector2 Size);
00189                 /// @brief Gets an already created rectangle by index.
00190                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the rectangle at the specified index.
00191                 Rectangle* GetRectangle(const Whole Index);
00192                 /// @brief Gets the OffsetRectangleInfo of an already created rectangle by index.
00193                 /// @return Returns a reference to the rectangle at the specified index.
00194                 OffsetRectangleInfo* GetOffsetRectangleInfo(const Whole Index);
00195                 /// @brief Gets the number of rectangles created and stored in this class.
00196                 /// @return Returns the number of rectangles this class is storing.
00197                 Whole GetNumRectangles();
00198                 /// @brief Destroys a rectangle.
00199                 /// @param ToBeDestroyed Pointer to the rectangle you want destroyed.
00200                 void DestroyRectangle(UI::Rectangle* ToBeDestroyed);
00201                 /// @brief Creates a caption within this Window.
00202                 /// @details This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).
00203                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the created caption.
00204                 /// @param Name The name of this caption.
00205                 /// @param Position The top left position of the caption.
00206                 /// @param Size The size of the Button.
00207                 /// @param Glyph One of the glyphs specified in your gorilla file.  Must be valid.
00208                 /// @param Text Any text you want printed on the caption.
00209                 Caption* CreateCaption(ConstString& Name, const Vector2 Position, const Vector2 Size, const Whole Glyph, String Text);
00210                 /// @brief Gets an already created caption by name.
00211                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the caption of the specified name.
00212                 Caption* GetCaption(ConstString& Name);
00213                 /// @brief Gets an already created caption by index.
00214                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the caption at the specified index.
00215                 Caption* GetCaption(const Whole Index);
00216                 /// @brief Gets the OffsetCaptionInfo of an already created caption by name.
00217                 /// @return Returns a reference to the caption of the specified name.
00218                 OffsetCaptionInfo* GetOffsetCaptionInfo(ConstString& Name);

00220                 /// @return Returns a reference to the caption at the specified index.
00221                 OffsetCaptionInfo* GetOffsetCaptionInfo(const Whole Index);
00222                 /// @brief Gets the number of captions created and stored in this class.
00223                 /// @return Returns the number of captions this class is storing.
00224                 Whole GetNumCaptions();
00225                 /// @brief Destroys a caption.
00226                 /// @param ToBeDestroyed Pointer to the caption you want destroyed.
00227                 void DestroyCaption(UI::Caption* ToBeDestroyed);
00228                 /// @brief Creates a markup text within this Window.
00229                 /// @details This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).
00230                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the created markup text.
00231                 /// @param Name The name of this markup text.
00232                 /// @param Position The top left position of the markup text.
00233                 /// @param Glyph One of the glyphs specified in your gorilla file.  Must be valid.
00234                 /// @param Text Any text you want printed on the markup text.
00235                 MarkupText* CreateMarkupText(ConstString& Name, const Vector2 Position, const Whole Glyph, String Text);

00244                 OffsetMarkupTextInfo* GetOffsetMarkupTextInfo(ConstString& Name);
00245                 /// @brief Gets the OffsetMarkupTextInfo of an already created markup text by index.
00246                 /// @return Returns a reference to the markup text at the specified index.
00247                 OffsetMarkupTextInfo* GetOffsetMarkupTextInfo(const Whole Index);
00248                 /// @brief Gets the number of markup texts created and stored in this class.
00249                 /// @return Returns the number of markup texts this class is storing.
00250                 Whole GetNumMarkupTexts();
00251                 /// @brief Destroys a markup text.
00252                 /// @param ToBeDestroyed Pointer to the markup text you want destroyed.
00253                 void DestroyMarkupText(UI::MarkupText* ToBeDestroyed);

00255                 // Working with all Widgets
00256                 ///////////////////////////////////////
00257                 /// @brief Gets an already created widget by name.
00258                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the widget of the specified name.
00259                 Widget* GetWidget(ConstString& Name);
00260                 /// @brief Gets an already created widget by index.
00261                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the widget at the specified index.

00276                 // Creating Widgets
00277                 ///////////////////////////////////////
00278                 /// @brief Creates a Scrollbar within this Window.
00279                 /// @details This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).
00280                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the created Scrollbar.
00281                 /// @param Name The name of the Scrollbar.
00282                 /// @param Position The top left position of the Scrollbar.
00283                 /// @param Size The size of the Scrollbar.
00284                 /// @param Style The style of scrollbar you want to create, see Scrollbar documentation for more details.
00285                 UI::Scrollbar* CreateScrollbar(ConstString& Name, const Vector2 Position, const Vector2 Size, UI::ScrollbarStyle Style);
00286                 /// @brief Creates a CheckBox within this Window.
00287                 /// @details This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).
00288                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the created CheckBox.
00289                 /// @param Name The name of the CheckBox.
00290                 /// @param Position The top left position of the CheckBox.
00291                 /// @param Size The size of the CheckBox.
00292                 /// @param Glyph The glyphs to use by default for use with the label.  Glyphs are defined in your .gorilla file.
00293                 /// @param LabelText The text to display with the label.  The label uses the Markup Text class, and thus it's
00294                 /// light markup text language.  You can also pass in a blank string if you don't wish to have a label, you can
00295                 /// create a label after construction.
00296                 UI::CheckBox* CreateCheckBox(ConstString& Name, const Vector2 Position, const Vector2 Size, const Whole Glyph, String &LabelText);
00297                 /// @brief Creates a Button List Box within this Window.
00298                 /// @details This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).
00299                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the created Button List Box.
00300                 /// @param Name The name of the Button List Box.
00301                 /// @param Position The top left position of the Button List Box.
00302                 /// @param Size The size of the Button List Box.
00303                 /// @param ScrollbarWidth The relative width of the scrollbar thats created with this widget.
00304                 /// @param ScrollbarStyle The style of scrollbar you want to create, see Scrollbar documentation for more details.
00305                 UI::ButtonListBox* CreateButtonListBox(ConstString& Name, const Vector2 Position, const Vector2 Size, const Real ScrollbarWidth, UI::ScrollbarStyle ScrollbarStyle);
00306                 /// @brief Creates a List Box within this Window.
00307                 /// @details This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).
00308                 /// @return Returns a pointer to the created List Box.
00309                 /// @param Name The name of the List Box.
00310                 /// @param Position The top left position of the List Box.
00311                 /// @param Size The size of the List Box.
00312                 /// @param ScrollbarWidth The relative width of the scrollbar thats created with this widget.
00313                 /// @param ScrollbarStyle The style of scrollbar you want to create, see Scrollbar documentation for more details.
00314                 UI::ListBox* CreateListBox(ConstString& Name, const Vector2 Position, const Vector2 Size, const Real ScrollbarWidth, UI::ScrollbarStyle ScrollbarStyle);
